name: Chef John's Ham and Potato Soup
author: Chef John
summary: You can never have too many soup recipes. This hearty soup is definitely filling enough to serve as a main course.
ingredients: 1 ½ pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and diced
1 tablespoon chopped fresh chives for garnish
directions: Melt butter in a stockpot over medium heat until golden brown
Stir in carrot, celery, onion, ham, and garlic; cook and stir for 5-6 minutes, until the vegetables soften and the onions are translucent
Stir in flour; cook for about 3 minutes
Stir in chicken broth, 1 cup at a time
Add water and stir to combine
Turn the heat to high and bring to a simmer
Simmer on medium-low for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally
Taste the soup for salt and add more if necessary
Stir in potatoes; cook for 15 minutes, until potatoes are tender
With a potato masher, mash the soup a few times, leaving plenty of whole chunks of potato
Season with salt and pepper to taste, add cayenne if desired, and add cream
Stir to combine and heat through
